58158C057DF944A089BE2FDA2FDCD874.description:
Describe the resources and benefits available through the Arizona Early Childhood Workforce Registry (i.e., classes and
trainings, annual licensing requirements, professional development, work experience, First Things First College Scholarships,
etc.)

CB251D7716454409AE02D47BBE1F4386.description:
Identify the role and initiatives of state agencies that support the professionalism of early childhood educators (i.e., FTF, ADHS,
DES, ADE, etc.)

426BCA2E9CD64A43ACB645405C56ADA0.description:
Explain the role of professional organizations in early childhood education (i.e., NAEYC, NAFCC, Council for Professional
Recognition, etc.)

0C986A24675B4B1B8ACD22C09A9D0CE4.description:
Identify confidentiality issues and strategies to handle them effectively (i.e., academic progress, behavior issues, child
observations, abuse and neglect matters, etc.)

5D693A9881CD490C97E12CD9357759BD.description: Explain state law in reporting suspected child abuse or neglect as presented in ARS 13‐3620 (e.g., process and mandates)

71412ECAB69D4A9D9AD7124E94D6A110.description:
Define child abuse (e.g., abandonment, inability to control a child, suspected mental, physical, and/or sexual abuse) and
neglect (e.g., physical, educational, emotional, and medical) as described in the Arizona Revised Statute (ARS 13‐3623)

FDBF009528FE4788811B37FA242C227A.description:
Discuss positive interpersonal behaviors with children, families, colleagues, and supervisors (i.e., two-way communication,
collaboration, maintaining positive relationships, etc.)

9B0EC5C408D84B4DA182F6F7E049A546.description:
Explore career pathways (i.e., pediatric nursing, social work, child psychology, etc.) and requirements within the early childhood
education profession (e.g., early childhood professional teacher certification)

F74C829012CB41D4ABE23852C4F8893D.description:
Identify the qualifications, skills, and aptitudes needed to work with children (i.e., ADHS staff requirements, child development
knowledge, strong communication skills, flexibility and understanding, creative ability, problem-solving skills, classroom
management, compassion and empathy, etc.)

7BD98EB71E7D4C3281F188C7C713AA49.description:
EXAMINE PROFESSIONALISM AND LEGAL AND ETHICAL PRACTICES IN THE EARLY
CHILDHOOD EDUCATION PROFESSION

C48EE62FFB8C4F52AD492F0124E1107C.description:
Observe and record behavior and development by using various forms/tools for observation (i.e., anecdotal notes,
developmental checklists, work samples, etc.)

B49A87EA810F4EDAA03FCA21ABBACB3B.description:
Identify ways to use data to inform instructional and guidance practices and possible referral for formal evaluation (e.g., collect,
analyze, and interpret)

08220ACAC409488781DAEDC401D4921F.description:
Explain the role families and caregivers play in the observation and assessment process of young children to strengthen the
partnership between home and school (i.e., provide background information, collaborative insight and concerns, advocacy, etc.)

DAFB5088E4C24846AC02C5E4BED9A77D.description:
Identify various forms of data that can be utilized in observation and assessment (e.g., family information cards, anecdotal
notes, and photographs)

F6FED53C71764D38804CDA46B431F804.description:
Compare and contrast subjective and objective documentation/statements (i.e., opinion vs. fact, description of observable
actions, refrain from assumptions and judgment, etc.)

DF195D5A49824C73ACD5309F7A226FE0.description:
Identify methods of documenting observations of young children to gain a comprehensive understanding of development,
needs, and interests (i.e., checklists, running records, structured observations, etc.)

F74856408F394B92A79E971DC8F58BE1.description:
EXAMINE OBSERVATION AND ASSESSMENT STRATEGIES IN EARLY CHILDHOOD
SETTINGS

ED6F3BC9392345BD8977BB0EBCA1ECAC.description:
Identify activities that demonstrate respect for culture, language, and individuality and create a caring community of learners
(i.e., books, storytelling, role playing, songs, games, art, etc.)

5B65B468765D4622B186607A20EAE27C.description:
Explain developmentally appropriate approaches to the positive guidance of young children (i.e., specify expectations and
limitations, redirect behavior, model conflict-resolution skills, positive language, etc.)

CB8BC279654C47E689D9EDEF22914692.description:
Explain how a child's behavior may be affected by changes in their home, school, and community environment (i.e., continuity
of care, socioeconomic and ecological factors, etc.)

7E051DD6AE3A42C6B0310C9EBF315BA4.description:
Recognize behaviors in children that may require strength-based trauma-informed care (i.e., sudden change in behavior, eating
poorly or sudden weight loss, nightmares, unusual amounts of crying or screaming, etc.)

8FE4270774DB492FA8FBBB9646A86E82.description:
Incorporate transition techniques to maximize learning (i.e., limit transitions, provide warnings, establish routines, plan ahead,
use songs or chants, etc.)

BAF1446017F24E4C8A81D9EC50C7DF98.description:
Model problem‐solving and conflict‐resolution skills with children (i.e., approach calmly, stop hurtful actions, acknowledge
child’s feelings, gather information, restate the problem, discuss solutions, provide follow-up support, etc.)

3DCCCC6F377F43E19BABFECE3E3ACC30.description:
Identify techniques to encourage children to identify, express, and regulate their emotions appropriately (i.e., read and interpret
cues, model appropriate regulation of emotions, name feelings, observe behaviors behind the feelings, etc.)

9FE918EF5E114D429EE5756E1D826940.description:
Describe techniques and strategies to encourage empathy, cooperation in play and learning including respect for the rights and
property of self and others (e.g., model empathy, discuss emotions, and acknowledge feelings)

3C0665A8130A462186F6EB63DC4EE732.description:
EXAMINE STRATEGIES THAT FOSTER AND PROMOTE PROSOCIAL BEHAVIOR IN
YOUNG CHILDREN

F9E7966DAAB5444ABEE6E07D6BC872C3.description:
Conduct a reflective evaluation of a learning experience including the mastery of objectives based on evaluation/assessment
results (i.e., purposeful observation, connected standards or guidelines, support child learning, continuous improvement, etc.)

D6F5106B71A34C8A8884A6EDFE41D363.description:
Conduct a developmentally appropriate learning experience for infants, toddlers, preschoolers, and early elementary age
children

CA5CCB96EA6C41DB9390732C41DBE227.description:
Examine creative fine arts’ experiences that nurture creativity and self‐expression in dramatic play for infants, toddlers,
preschool, and early elementary age children (i.e., puppetry-uses and benefits, role-play stories and real-life experiences, etc.)

3376BBC27B5E4D26BCE0F84DEFC6BF84.description:
Examine creative fine arts’ experiences that nurture creativity and self‐expression in music and creative movement for infants,
toddlers, preschool, and early elementary age children (i.e., cross-curricular use of music and movement, safe use and care of
musical instruments, etc.)

AFB1B96B95E1456EBB568EB5362933C1.description:
Examine creative fine arts’ experiences that nurture creativity and self‐expression in visual arts for infants, toddlers, preschool,
and early elementary age children (i.e., process rather than product, variation of tools, imagination, self-esteem, etc.)

859E55B0947D4FD98FCA7EFB9D5F0A90.description:
Examine learning opportunities or experiences that promote physical development in infants, toddlers, preschool, and early
elementary age children (i.e., safe environments that encourage physical exploration, equipment to create experiences
promoting fine and gross motor skills, limited restrictive equipment, etc.)

841C988978674A049BC185E69E301EE5.description:
Examine science‐learning opportunities or experiences for infants, toddlers, preschool, and early elementary age children (i.e.,
hands-on activities, exploration, inquiry, discovery, etc.)

35394061AE954DA3A921DAFC21C9E14A.description:
Examine hands‐on mathematical learning opportunities or experiences that nurture the natural drive to explore and experiment
with numbers, shapes, measurement, and patterns in infants, toddlers, preschool, and early elementary age children (i.e., prior
experience and knowledge, problem-solving and reasoning, active play and use of manipulatives, etc.)

971C62C6156E4703A078378B90E35D36.description:
Examine learning opportunities or experiences that foster language and literacy development in infants, toddlers, preschool,
and early elementary age children (i.e., read-aloud, singing songs, phonemic and vocabulary activities, storytelling with puppets
and props, etc.)

67D6846525A2482F964FD09866FBEF6A.description:
Examine social studies’ concepts through everyday social and environmental interactions in infants, toddlers, preschool, and
early elementary age children (i.e., community engagement, global and environmental awareness, current events, etc.)

ABFB757E1AC146A5A49C105BC65BA931.description:
Examine opportunities or experiences that promote social/emotional development in infants, toddlers, preschool, and early
elementary age children (i.e., positive reinforcement, conflict resolution skills, cooperative learning, positive role modeling, etc.)

E3633A7E129B4732915011865864D807.description:
Describe the basic components of a learning experience plan (e.g., learning objectives/goals, appropriate materials, and
evaluation/assessment)

735C1EDD13704F2B81AC26847C24DADD.description:
EXAMINE DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE AND MEANINGFUL LEARNING
EXPERIENCES

B116CC44239B47EEB18B3C82183564BB.description:
Recognize environmental considerations for children with special needs (e.g., adaptive devices, accessibility, and sensory
accommodations)

D8752A4D7E8143098E84061585FA8523.description:
Develop a daily schedule (i.e. predictable, routine, responsive and flexible schedules, etc.) that meets the learning and
developmental needs of children and allows for teacher‐initiated and child‐initiated activities with limited transitions

C6C523603A52493B8EE998F14AC753B5.description:
Describe how to set up an environment to facilitate planned and spontaneous indoor and outdoor activities (i.e., accessibility,
room arrangement, spacing, etc.)

8A146213CAF9458F8553EE9F06B10F7E.description:
Describe early elementary centers as an indoor or outdoor area of learning and playing, and select appropriate materials and
equipment for development [e.g., Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, Math (STEAM)]

917095D887714B56981818A107ADA9A4.description:
Describe preschool learning centers as an indoor or outdoor area of learning and playing, and select appropriate materials and
equipment for development [i.e., spaces for group experiences, privacy, storage, and display; toys and materials that represent
the cultures, interests, and learning goals; safe, diverse, and developmentally appropriate; common preschool learning centers
(i.e., blocks, science, music, etc.)]

248A9BE157E8446A82E72239721A46A7.description:
Describe toddler learning centers as an indoor or outdoor area of learning and playing, and select appropriate materials and
equipment for development (i.e., spaces for group experiences, privacy, storage, and display; toys and materials that represent
the cultures, interests, and learning goals; safe, diverse, and developmentally appropriate, equipment for care routines; etc.)

BB61A7A8A48B4A30800641776BD18549.description:
Describe infant learning centers as an indoor or outdoor area of learning and playing, and select appropriate materials and
equipment for development (i.e., spaces for group experiences, privacy, storage, and display; toys and materials that represent
the cultures, interests, and learning goals; safe, diverse, and developmentally appropriate, equipment for care routines; etc.)

E2B6754927B144AC9C5790DA68BE3BF3.description:
EXAMINE DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE LEARNING ENVIRONMENTS FOR YOUNG
CHILDREN

FCB8EB35B2664100A99490743D073296.description:
Demonstrate culturally responsive practices in the classroom (i.e., seek to understand students and the community, family
involvement and engagement, incorporate diversity in lesson planning, etc.)

A325E7AABA46456EA502653D9BFACACA.description:
Explain the content interconnection across the domains of learning as essential for developing a holistic and integrated
approach to education (i.e., emergent, experimental and cooperative learning, exploration and extension of child’s interests,
etc.)

E4842AACD5D24DEB8FB378E160A585DB.description:
Discuss instructional strategies to meet individual and group needs (i.e., 504 plan, gifted education, IEP, IFSP, RtI, UDL, ELL,
etc.)

C4D04D20F4B143849E8D20D14D0EC0E6.description:
Identify developmentally appropriate technological aids and media resources that align with children’s cognitive abilities and
developmental stages to support learning (i.e., Empower Guidebook, NAEYC, AAP, etc.)

4C9794E3D3354F6C9F775DB486276031.description:
Explain how to create challenges and scaffold children’s experiences to support growth, development, and learning (i.e., ask
prompting questions, make suggestions, build off prior knowledge, etc.)

93289061DE054D319D0E79FC389EF8DC.description:
Explore ways to acknowledge and encourage children’s efforts and provide specific feedback that goes beyond simple
acknowledgement and praise (i.e., eye contact, body language, listen, reflect, and react, etc.)

51BCC2057590443C8A2E04AC613A302C.description: Practice asking questions that prompt children’s thinking (e.g., why-, what if-, how-, opinion-, and other open ended-questions)

364EC89C828040CABAD6772A74B7053D.description:
Describe developmentally appropriate practices as outlined by NAEYC (i.e., strengths-based, play-based approach, culturally,
linguistically, and ability appropriate for each child, etc.)

09AA8C5F689648B493DA2E5512359289.description:
Explain how the Arizona Academic Standards may be used to guide the development of learning experiences and opportunities
for early elementary children in kindergarten through grade 3

4286429C2A444E5CA3FB189A54051B9E.description:
Explain how the Arizona Early Learning Standards may be used to guide the development of learning experiences and
opportunities for preschoolers 3 to 5 years

D8C2A2905BEB40F3A11536EF8DE3E980.description:
Explain how the Arizona Infant and Toddler Developmental Guidelines may be used to guide the development of learning
experiences and opportunities for young children birth to 36 months

41E901E6D20B4AC6A669623C2984D770.description:
EXAMINE DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE GUIDELINES, STANDARDS, AND
PRACTICES TO MAXIMIZE LEARNING EXPERIENCES

02E8B5FBC850403C9802399772AD233D.description:
Describe the appropriate informal (i.e., verbal updates, email or text messages, etc.) and written communication with family
members (i.e., newsletters, handbooks, progress reports, etc.)

A1CA08BFF0E04270AEC7903747AA5A97.description: Describe strategies to enhance community engagement (i.e., library, fire truck, field trips, family resources, etc.)

94F147F0BB834FB0AF7960D21A37B44C.description:
Describe components of effective family conversations in an early childhood setting (i.e., active listening, two-way
communication, support and assist with homework and projects, etc.)

740AAD1DB0394A5FBCDD571290EE82EF.description:
Discuss a variety of strategies to welcome and engage all families (i.e., family conferences, parent night, home-school
connections, special events, etc.)

3C8C34D326BE4CC39DD6EB84062F0AB1.description:
Identify ways to involve the family in the education of the child for their overall development and well-being (i.e., educate
families, provide multiple modes of communication, build relationships, etc.)

7DB8B3DEA9364B6A8202DAAE20CBA070.description:
Identify the family/guardianship role in the education of the child (i.e., primary support, create a home learning environment,
encourage and support education, etc.)

66025DB3A17347C287136843CB14ED89.description: EXAMINE STRATEGIES TO BUILD FAMILY AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT

D64FA43C7BC149CFA3862E17AA76D078.description: Implement a plan for emergency procedures (i.e., evacuation, shelter in place, lockdown, etc.)

E692BDDBB3D24BC2BED1FC10C37562E4.description: Identify basic First Aid and CPR techniques for infants and children (i.e., bleeding, choking, sprains, fractures, poisoning, etc.)

73459918B82B4DF580B1105805199985.description:
Describe cleaning and sanitation procedures (i.e., maintaining the facility, equipment and materials, laundry and dishwashing
procedures, etc.)

38F69EE1F6FA4867AAF9717DDF69FE0E.description:
Describe basic health practices and prevention procedures to reduce childhood illnesses and communicable diseases (e.g.,
safe food handling, handwashing, and cleaning and sanitation)

834FB8267332434C81A67B8822A7C712.description:
Identify possible health and safety hazards (indoor and outdoor) of childcare environments (e.g., compliance with appropriate
licensing regulations)

CD066F3A27FE47498BD97467F2623914.description: Identify and wear appropriate clothing and shoes to ensure personal safety (i.e., closed-toe shoes, jewelry, etc.)

DB5F98048AB0429FB9E91DBCC42522A7.description:
Promote physical well-being for children (i.e., conduct daily health checks, recognize abuse indicators, document injury and
illness, etc.)

3B2F067169554A2786CDB925D02ECE7C.description: EXAMINE ESSENTIAL HEALTH AND SAFETY PRACTICES IN EARLY CHILDHOOD

C2A8735D3FAC4E03B4D1F51E9864E969.description:
Explain how mealtimes can be used as learning opportunities to support children’s development in all domains (e.g., social and
emotional; language and communication; physical; and sensory)

41C114567E8742D6BFACBB7D54F7023D.description:
Explain the purpose of food guides in accordance with snack and meal requirements (e.g., MyPlate, Empower Guidebook, and
CACFP)

840316AA23A746FCACA5C1AB814544BE.description:
Identify practices that promote safe food handling (i.e., handwashing before and during food preparation, proper food storage,
food safety guidelines, personal hygiene, etc.)

F464D2F9C2F145578EB6F783C5EF9644.description: Recognize special dietary needs of children (i.e., food allergies, preferences, choking hazards, medical conditions, etc.)

D17A80F3915A42D2859D02109B5EDD3B.description:
Explain the consequences of an unbalanced diet relating to childhood obesity and oral health (i.e., sedentary activities, chronic
diseases, baby bottle tooth decay, etc.)

F2B22371601C4F37BC95AC61454DDCBA.description:
Construct menus and food experiences that meet food and nutrition guidelines for young children (e.g., MyPlate, Empower
Guidebook, and CACFP)

355BE13D05624B16BD4EB2DD4D74A1C6.description:
Discuss personal care procedures for children (e.g., diapering and toileting, napping and resting, feeding and eating, and care
routines)

8012186D121C430E82B635996DB24821.description: EXAMINE ESSENTIAL NUTRITION AND WELLNESS PRACTICES IN EARLY CHILDHOOD

2842BDD7EBA848BFAFDA7F7CA02E07C8.description:
Locate and describe the state standards of early development and high-quality learning environments (e.g., Arizona’s Early
Learning Standards, Arizona’s Infant and Toddler Developmental Guidelines, and Program Guidelines for High Quality Early
Care and Education: Birth through Kindergarten)

18227E8267D1478BAB7D75D398CE89EA.description:
Explain compliance with the Arizona Department of Health Services Bureau of Child Care Licensing Regulations (e.g., 10-Day
Staff Training Checklist)

69D2C98F47FC4CC8A6CC0536687CF352.description:
Identify voluntary options (i.e., accreditation, standards, guidelines, etc.) that promote high-quality in early childhood
environments (i.e., DCC; NAEYC; NAFCC; NSACA; FTF; FTF Quality First; QRIS; Arizona Program Guidelines for High Quality
Early Care and Education: Birth through Kindergarten; etc.)

EAFB255B03364C7DAB98BE00BF081D54.description:
Identify different organizations/entities that regulate early childhood environments (e.g., Arizona Department of Health Services
Bureau of Child Care Licensing Regulations and local fire departments)

AC2AA811062047CF8C8718E31CDAE369.description: EXAMINE REGULATIONS, STANDARDS, AND GUIDELINES THAT PROMOTE HIGHQUALITY ENVIRONMENTS FOR YOUNG CHILDREN

6EF9883955AC4B51B86F570D0F44CDE4.description:
Explain how developmentally appropriate play impacts overall development of early elementary age children in each domain
(e.g., social, emotional, language and communication, cognitive, and physical)

DFF552B9C98540D1B8023B0F9099EE90.description: Describe physical development in early elementary age children (e.g., motor skills, strength, coordination, and sensory abilities)

50F59D6872984230AF9756B956A5F165.description:
Describe cognitive development in early elementary age children (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding,
processing, and organizing information about the world around them)

E50B9C5A3CAB4309B34B81B376E7C9F8.description: Describe language and communication development in early elementary age children (e.g., verbal and nonverbal)

E380E4FD9B004040BF3A9671CC859815.description:
Discuss the emotional development of early elementary age children (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding,
expressing, and regulating emotions)

8AE604D2F3A64B06A9ABFD912ADF74B7.description:
Describe social development in early elementary age children (e.g., acquisition of skills and behaviors enabling interaction with
others and understanding social cues)

C267C48D80FC4A26B3E6A403FB1B92F5.description:
Compare and contrast characteristics of typical and atypical development in early elementary age children (e.g., physical and
motor skills, cognitive, social, and emotional)

EDE04460DB5B49B6B74399A866590687.description:
EXAMINE EARLY ELEMENTARY AGE CHILD DEVELOPMENT (KINDERGARTEN THROUGH
GRADE 3)

743FCFB0A38F4FD4B9A60D86343645F2.description:
Explain how developmentally appropriate play impacts overall development of preschoolers in each domain (e.g., social,
emotional, language and communication, cognitive, and physical)

FA8ADE5BBB4B41E38A0F628A7A603D31.description: Describe physical development in preschoolers (e.g., motor skills, strength, coordination, and sensory abilities)

0F6D578B49AD4F7B8CB78D14F2827D4A.description:
Describe cognitive development in preschoolers (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding, processing, and organizing
information about the world around them)

A6026A7D4DAF4972A98D601B241131A8.description: Describe language and communication development in preschoolers (e.g., verbal and nonverbal)

0062258B2C6F4222954991A229513DCD.description:
Discuss the emotional development of preschoolers (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding, expressing, and
regulating emotions)

E22CC483793442179DE73B37731B5B52.description:
Describe social development in preschoolers (e.g., acquisition of skills and behaviors enabling interaction with others and
understanding social cues)

21DCE8B25E7F4E0D95B76E7E31FDB2CF.description:
Compare and contrast characteristics of typical and atypical development in preschoolers (e.g., physical and motor skills,
cognitive, social, and emotional)

0CDF7B081D46412897054B5CB9D599BD.description:
Explain how developmentally appropriate play impacts overall development of toddlers in each domain (e.g., social, emotional,
language and communication, cognitive, and physical)

957F7CB6A3124903875C1A4A91868277.description: Describe physical development in toddlers (e.g., motor skills, strength, coordination, and sensory abilities)

5745545C7DEA4EC1849E5BD295279E27.description:
Describe cognitive development in toddlers (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding, processing, and organizing
information about the world around them)

3722046876EF40869AB6C353DB8D4CE4.description: Describe language and communication development in toddlers (e.g., verbal and nonverbal)

2057D2EAA8E8487C86EAA86DC5D07715.description:
Discuss the emotional development of toddlers (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding, expressing, and regulating
emotions)

F6C94A5940884269BD05DAB6DCA7E2E2.description:
Describe social development in toddlers (e.g., acquisition of skills and behaviors enabling interaction with others and
understanding social cues)

3F7F86BAE8FF43DFA8C989D954BCFC0A.description:
Compare and contrast characteristics of typical and atypical development in toddlers (e.g., physical and motor skills, cognitive,
social, and emotional)

F5D156644C3049BB9AF4CB9FBE015380.description:
Explain how developmentally appropriate play impacts overall development of infants in each domain (e.g., social, emotional,
language and communication, cognitive, and physical)

D2D7ECF61D9248FBA24CA6A00D95DC5F.description: Describe physical development in infants (e.g., rapid changes in size, strength, coordination, motor skills, and sensory abilities)

4DE623E4A3834534ADAE7C897AE356D4.description:
Describe cognitive development in infants (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding, processing, and organizing
information about the world around them)

A7DB27C5061F4B2E84A79A881DB02E48.description: Describe language and communication development in infants (e.g., verbal and nonverbal)

9CBA4D5BB371439CA486B0CD7217E84A.description:
Discuss the emotional development of infants (e.g., acquisition of skills related to understanding, expressing, and regulating
emotions)

FA2F3843391D46AF8A2C58F1984BB38B.description:
Describe social development in infants (e.g., acquisition of skills and behaviors enabling interaction with others and
understanding social cues)

5BB755D80EEA43E18C9EAFFA595FEF42.description:
Compare and contrast characteristics of typical and atypical development in infants (e.g., physical and motor skills, cognitive,
social, and emotional)

1B396DF989034AB18E4DAE74E039CA85.description: Identify causes of common birth defects (i.e., down syndrome, cleft lip/palate, cerebral palsy, etc.)

BD168F94E5FC4ABF9E9A5E5F43C1B3EB.description:
Explain the effect of environmental factors on prenatal development (i.e., pollutants, chemicals in pesticides and cleaning
agents, etc.)

77104D3D2C9C42B2BB91481316A34E2D.description:
Explain the effect of maternal health, prenatal care (e.g., age, nutrition, existing medical conditions, environment, and regular
medical checkups), and lifestyle choices (i.e., drugs, alcohol, smoking/vaping, etc.) on prenatal development

1C6B51B1894E4B42896B278A281B7FC6.description: Explain the effect of genetic factors on prenatal development (i.e., chromosomal errors, genetic predispositions, etc.)

0F1A0971FBB64E13BA6A625CADE32E95.description: Identify the stages of prenatal development (e.g., germinal, embryonic, and fetal stages)

C9A42ACE6996419085317EECD1A12DE3.description: EXAMINE THE FACTORS INFLUENCING PRENATAL DEVELOPMENT

DAAC189F6AEC47758FBF43BFFF5C251E.description:
Explore and identify current early brain development research and its applications (i.e., Daniel Siegel and the Mindful
Awareness Research Center, pruning, influences of early experiences on brain development, structure of the brain, etc.)

19931D97F67E425B9692F2A390E45DFB.description: Identify the developmental domains (e.g., physical, social, emotional, cognitive, and language and communication)

EE29399EC8474FB1B7E654617E70A611.description: Compare and contrast various early childhood programs and their implications (e.g., Montessori, Reggio, and Head Start)

80C22FEF672243A19F46EDC5A17FFA4B.description:
Compare and contrast teaching approaches for early childhood education (i.e., Constructivist, Collaborative, Inquiry-Based
Learning, etc.)

4F7D389C83304139B9215D10D7C9AEFB.description: Compare and contrast child development theories and their implications (e.g., Piaget, Maslow, Vygotsky, Gardner, and Erikson)

B659E514A9684C6A8EDBBA1DE3485C7F.description: Explore influences on human development (e.g., environmental, psychological, cultural, genetic, and hereditary factors)

2243B008D35443E785D37D421519F925.description:
EXAMINE THE CONCEPTS, IMPLICATIONS, AND THEORETICAL APPROACHES OF EARLY
CHILDHOOD EDUCATION
